data.title: The Advantages Of A Polyglot Programmer

data.text:
Last year, I learned Go. It took me around a week or two to learn it. In the past two years, I also took a deep dive into modern JavaScript and its typesafe cousin TypeScript. Every now and then, I try to get up to speed with the latest tactics in C and C++. At the moment, I am trying to improve my skills with Swift for iOS. When I last touched PHP years ago, I realized how my skills in PHP have become rusty. To be honest, I do not really have a use case for PHP at the moment and very little people ask me about it. My Visual Basic knowledge vanished years ago already.

A programming language has always been one of the many tools in my programmer toolbox. In my brain, they reside next to operating systems like Linux or macOS, my skills on the Unix, Linux and BSD shells and the numerous other systems and languages including SQL, HTML, CSS, CloudFormation, Terraform and whatnot.

Why specialize in a programming language?

When a good friend of mine asked me to help out with some C# code, it completely blew my brains out. I had abandoned C# in 2012 just because it was no longer part of my projects and I never needed it afterwards. I also managed to spend very little time with Java.
